node.title: Auckland woman jailed for smuggling more than 19m cigarettes into country
node.description: She helped smuggle $18.7m in tobacco revenue.
node.content: ["An Auckland woman has been jailed for three years for her part in smuggling more than $18.7m of tobacco into the country.\u00a0", "Hua Yi Zhu, 50, was sentenced at the Auckland District Court on Thursday for smuggling 19,419,400 cigarettes and revenue fraud of more than $18.7m in tobacco spanning a four-year period.\u00a0", "Zhu's sentencing marks the successful completion of Operation Whitethorn, a Customs investigation into a long-running tobacco smuggling enterprise.", "Operation Whitethorn began in 2018 when Zhu\u2019s husband Yu Zhi Hu was identified supplying large amounts of cigarettes to wholesale purchasers. In March 2020, Hu was sentenced to five years and three months\u2019 imprisonment for smuggling cigarettes in shipping containers from China, using their legitimate furniture business as cover.", "Operation Whitethorn involved Customs officers using surveillance, detailed analysis of trade and financial data, cargo examinations and search warrants to uncover the multi-million dollar fraud, locating $4.15m in cash at three Auckland addresses.\u00a0", "Customs also partnered with the Police\u2019s Asset Recovery Unit to seize over $5.5m in cash, bank accounts, property and vehicles as a result."]
